description: From Middle English conduen, condien, French conduire (“to conduct”), from Latin conducere.

verbs.description: cond (third-person singular simple present conds, present participle conding, simple past and past participle conded)

entries.meaning: Obsolete spelling of con (“direct or steer a ship”)
examples: Sometimes he who conds the ship will be speaking to him at helm at every little yaw; which the sea-faring men love not, as being a kind of disgrace to their steerage; then in mockage they will say, sure the channel is narrow he conds so thick  […]
